name: Hadoop MapReduce
description: MapReduce is a programming model and an associated implementation for processing and generating large data sets with a parallel, distributed algorithm on a cluster.  The name MapReduce originally referred to the proprietary Google technology, but has since been genericized. MapReduce as a big data processing model is considered dead by many domain experts, as development has moved on to more capable and less disk-oriented mechanisms that incorporate full map and reduce capabilities.

down.yarn: MapReduce jobs are decomposed into tasks that are scheduled and deployed by YARN.
down.hdfs: MapReduce jobs can read and write data residing in HDFS.
down.hbase: MapReduce jobs can read and write data residing in HBase.
down.kudu: MapReduce jobs can read and write data residing in Kudu.
down.cassandra: MapReduce jobs can read and write data from Cassandra.
